metadata.title: CVE-2019-19905 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
NetHack 3.6.x before 3.6.4 is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability whenreading very long lines from configuration files. This affects systems thathave NetHack installed suid/sgid, and shared systems that allow users toupload their own configuration files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nethack-common - 3.6.6-1
nethack-console - 3.6.6-1
nethack-qt - 3.6.6-1
nethack-x11 - 3.6.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nethack package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.6-1').
